title: [SETUP-BUG] Python 3.5 not supported.
body:
Databricks only supports python 3.5. MLFlow only supports python 3.6 and above. I want to develop in a local pyspark environment and deploy the final solution to databricks using MLFlow. How is this achieved?

https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/projects.html#run-an-mlflow-project-on-databricks

```
conda create --name local_spark python=3.5
conda activate local_spark
conda install -c conda-forge pyspark
conda install -c conda-forge mlflow
```

Output:
```
Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed with current_repodata.json, will retry with next repodata source.
Initial quick solve with frozen env failed.  Unfreezing env and trying again.
Solving environment: failed with current_repodata.json, will retry with next repodata source.
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed
Initial quick solve with frozen env failed.  Unfreezing env and trying again.
Solving environment: failed

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found
to be incompatible with the existing python installation in your environment:

  - mlflow -> python[version='2.7.*,3.6.*,>=3.6,<3.7.0a0,>=3.7,<3.8.0a0']

If python is on the left-most side of the chain, that's the version you've asked for.
When python appears to the right, that indicates that the thing on the left is somehow
not available for the python version you are constrained to.  Your current python version
is (python=3.5).  Note that conda will not change your python version to a different minor version
unless you explicitly specify that.

The following specifications were found to be incompatible with each other:



Package pip conflicts for:
python=3.5 -> pip
mlflow -> mleap[version='>=0.8.1'] -> scikit-learn[version='>=0.18.dev0'] -> scipy -> numpy[version='1.10.*,1.11.*,>=1.11.3,<2.0a0,>=1.9,>=1.9.3,<2.0a0'] -> mkl_random -> mkl-service[version='>=2,<3.0a0'] -> six -> python[version='2.7.*,3.6.*,>=3.6,<3.7.0a0,>=3.7,<3.8.0a0'] -> pip
Package setuptools conflicts for:
python=3.5 -> pip -> wheel -> setuptools
mlflow -> mleap[version='>=0.8.1'] -> scikit-learn[version='>=0.18.dev0'] -> scipy -> numpy[version='1.10.*,1.11.*,>=1.11.3,<2.0a0,>=1.9,>=1.9.3,<2.0a0'] -> mkl_random -> mkl-service[version='>=2,<3.0a0'] -> six -> python[version='2.7.*,3.6.*,>=3.6,<3.7.0a0,>=3.7,<3.8.0a0'] -> pip -> wheel -> setuptools
Package wheel conflicts for:
python=3.5 -> pip -> wheel
mlflow -> mleap[version='>=0.8.1'] -> scikit-learn[version='>=0.18.dev0'] -> scipy -> numpy[version='1.10.*,1.11.*,>=1.11.3,<2.0a0,>=1.9,>=1.9.3,<2.0a0'] -> mkl_random -> mkl-service[version='>=2,<3.0a0'] -> six -> python[version='2.7.*,3.6.*,>=3.6,<3.7.0a0,>=3.7,<3.8.0a0'] -> pip -> wheel

```
